content.text:
A 49-year-old man has had marked chest pain for the last 4 hours. An EKG shows ST segment elevation. Laboratory studies show cardiac troponin of 10 ng/mL. The representative gross appearance of his disease process is depicted here. Which of the following findings is most likely to occur in this man? <image 1> 

A. Liquefactive necrosis
B. Caseous necrosis
C. Coagulative necrosis
D. Wet gangrene

C. Coagulative necrosis

Coagulative necrosis is the most likely finding in this scenario. It typically occurs in conditions like myocardial infarction ( (heart attack), where the blood supply to the heart muscle is disrupted, leading to the death of the tissue. The image shows a heart with a large area of necrosis, which is consistent with coagulative necrosis.
Now, output the final answer and nothing else:
